meanings.definition: Prohibited or forbidden by social custom or practice.
meanings.sent1: Wearing pajamas to a formal event is considered tabu.
meanings.sent2: It is tabu to talk loudly in a library.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite tabu to wear a swimsuit to a job interview.
meanings.sent4: In some cultures, eating with your left hand is seen as tabu.
meanings.sent5: Breaking the queue is a tabu behavior in this country.

meanings.definition: A prohibition or ban on something.
meanings.sent1: The government imposed a tabu on smoking in public places.
meanings.sent2: The school has a tabu on using cell phones during class.
meanings.sent3: The tabu on eating sugary snacks in the office is hard to resist.
meanings.sent4: The tabu on entering the abandoned house only made it more intriguing.
meanings.sent5: The tabu on discussing politics at family gatherings keeps the peace.

meanings.definition: A social or religious custom prohibiting or restricting a particular practice.
meanings.sent1: The tribe has a tabu against hunting certain animals.
meanings.sent2: The tabu against wearing white after Labor Day is outdated.
meanings.sent3: It's a tabu to wear shoes inside the temple.
meanings.sent4: The tabu on eating meat during Lent is a common practice.
meanings.sent5: The tabu on speaking during the ceremony was strictly enforced.
